page.title: 06Local Government in Felton
page.content: The Group Parish Council of Ocle Pychard has three members from Ocle Pychard, three from Ullingswick and two from Felton. The councillors are elected to serve for three years. The council deals with planning applications sending comments to the Malvern Hills District Council. Complaints or problems from residents are passed on by the Parish Council to the appropriate body, in particular the state of roads and drainage. The Parish Council is also responsible for the publication of a bi-monthly community news-letter. Refuse collection operates on a fortnightly basis in Ulingswick and Felton and is run by sub-contractors to the Malvern Hills District Council. In Preston Wynne refuse is collected weekly by the Council's own lorry.
